body: @timoschilling maybe we need to document authentication_keys better but the idea is that once configuring it, you should update the error messages. That's because having a generic message is bad for everyone and having a message that works on all cases can become way too complex. Thanks for the report!

@josevalim why not a generic message?

``` yaml
devise.failure.invalid: 'Invalid %{authentication_keys} and password.'
```

``` ruby
I18n.t 'devise.failure.invalid', authentication_keys: authentication_keys.join(", ")
```

You are right, that would work. :D The issue is that I am not sure if we will have access to the authentication_keys when we generate the message. But that may have changed. Can you please investigate?
I will take a look on that.

Somewhat related to this ticket, the default error messages are not consistent between entering a invalid username and an invalid password.
- Valid username & invalid pwd: "Invalid email or password."
- Invalid username & invalid pwd: "Invalid email address or password."

Its minor, but guessing it would be better to make the message consistent between the two use cases (i.e. provide no indication of whether the username or password is incorrect).

Let me know if it would be better to create a separate ticket for this.

Pong, I need some days, maybe next week...

> On 18.09.2014, at 20:07, José Valim notifications@github.com wrote:
> 
> Ping @timoschilling :)
> 
> —
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub.

This seems to be close but there is a scenario when it doesn't work:
1. In `devise.rb`: `config.authentication_keys = [ :username ]`
2. In second auth model `Admin` (the first one is `User`): `devise :database_authenticatable, :rememberable, :trackable, :authentication_keys => [ :email ]`

So when admin fails to login, the error message says: `Invalid username or password.` — while `email` should be used instead of `username`.
Yes, @carlosantoniodasilva found already found that problem in https://github.com/plataformatec/devise/pull/3218#discussion_r17965071. But I don't have the time to work on that.

issue.title: Update devise-i18n in / from 1.4.0 to 1.5.0
issue.body:
[Dependencies.io](https://www.dependencies.io) has updated `devise-i18n` (a rubygems dependency in `/`) from "1.4.0" to "1.5.0".

<details>
<summary>1.5.0</summary>

- Require devise 3.4 and above.
- Updated error keys to use the devise-configured authentication keys instead of always "email" or translated equivalent (feature introduced in [devise#3201](https://github.com/plataformatec/devise/issues/3201)).
- Added si translation.
- Updated de, el, fi, fr, pl, pt-BR, zh-CN, and zh-TW translations.

</details>

issue.title: Bump devise-i18n from 1.1.2 to 1.5.1
issue.body:
Bumps [devise-i18n](https://github.com/tigrish/devise-i18n) from 1.1.2 to 1.5.1.
Release notes *Sourced from devise-i18n's [releases](https://github.com/tigrish/devise-i18n/releases).* > ## v1.5.1 > - Devise looks up a different key on login failure if the user exists. This can be used by other users to determine if specific user is already registered, even if Devise is in paranoid mode (which normally tries to prevent this). This has been filed as [devise issue #4763](https://github.com/plataformatec/devise/issues/4763). Updated some translations that were using different strings for these keys to mitigate the issue. > - Updated de, el, es, et, fa, ja, nl, pl, pt-BR, ru, si, sv, vi, and zh-CN translations. > > ## v1.5.0 > - Require devise 3.4 and above. > - Updated error keys to use the devise-configured authentication keys instead of always "email" or translated equivalent (feature introduced in [devise#3201](https://github.com/plataformatec/devise/issues/3201)). > - Added si translation. > - Updated de, el, fi, fr, pl, pt-BR, zh-CN, and zh-TW translations. > > ## v1.4.0 > - Add a requirement for devise 3.1 and above. > - Removed backwards compatibility for mailer tokens for devise versions before 3.1.0. Any views generated into your app prior to this release of devise-i18n should continue to work. If, for some reason, you are otherwise calling `DeviseI18n::ViewHelpers` methods (`resource_confirmation_token`, `resource_reset_password_token`, and `resource_unlock_token`), you will need to replace these calls with `[**token**](https://github.com/token)`. > - Update ja translation. > > ## v1.3.0 > - Added a requirement for devise 2 and above. This is in preparation for upping the minimum devise version in a future release to support updated text in devise. > - Fix reset_password_token for devise 4. [#150](https://github.com/tigrish/devise-i18n/issues/150) > - Added tl and ur translations. > - Updated ar, fr, fr-CA, it, ja, ko, ms, nb, nn-NO, no, pt-BR, zh-CN, and zh-TW translations. > > ## v1.2.0 > - Made all possible attribute names from all devise modules localizable. > - Added es, ha, ig, lo-LA, yo, and zh-YUE translations. > - Updated bg, cs, de, es-MX, fr-CA, ja, ka, nl, pt-BR, sk, sl, zh-CN, and zh-TW translations. > - Corrected Malay locale code (from my to ms).
Changelog *Sourced from devise-i18n's [changelog](https://github.com/tigrish/devise-i18n/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md).* > ## 1.5.1 > > - Devise looks up a different key on login failure if the user exists. This can be used by other users to determine if specific user is already registered, even if Devise is in paranoid mode (which normally tries to prevent this). This has been filed as [devise issue #4763](https://github.com/plataformatec/devise/issues/4763). Updated some translations that were using different strings for these keys to mitigate the issue. > - Updated de, el, es, et, fa, ja, nl, pl, pt-BR, ru, si, sv, vi, and zh-CN translations. > > ## 1.5.0 > > - Require devise 3.4 and above. > - Updated error keys to use the devise-configured authentication keys instead of always "email" or translated equivalent (feature introduced in [devise#3201](https://github.com/plataformatec/devise/issues/3201)). > - Added si translation. > - Updated de, el, fi, fr, pl, pt-BR, zh-CN, and zh-TW translations. > > ## 1.4.0 > > - Add a requirement for devise 3.1 and above. > - Removed backwards compatibility for mailer tokens for devise versions before 3.1.0. Any views generated into your app prior to this release of devise-i18n should continue to work. If, for some reason, you are otherwise calling `DeviseI18n::ViewHelpers` methods (`resource_confirmation_token`, `resource_reset_password_token`, and `resource_unlock_token`), you will need to replace these calls with `[**token**](https://github.com/token)`. > - Update ja translation. > > ## 1.3.0 > > - Added a requirement for devise 2 and above. This is in preparation for upping the minimum devise version in a future release to support updated text in devise. > - Fix reset_password_token for devise 4. [#150](https://github.com/tigrish/devise-i18n/issues/150) > - Added tl and ur translations. > - Updated ar, fr, fr-CA, it, ja, ko, ms, nb, nn-NO, no, pt-BR, zh-CN, and zh-TW translations. > > ## 1.2.0 > > - Made all possible attribute names from all devise modules localizable. > - Added es, ha, ig, lo-LA, yo, and zh-YUE translations. > - Updated bg, cs, de, es-MX, fr-CA, ja, ka, nl, pt-BR, sk, sl, zh-CN, and zh-TW translations. > - Corrected Malay locale code (from my to ms).
Commits - [`06d3823`](https://github.com/tigrish/devise-i18n/commit/06d38239896c66eaf850b29669c5aebc6bc7e206) v1.5.1 - [`81ed6a8`](https://github.com/tigrish/devise-i18n/commit/81ed6a8cf73fc4023d47088876f3bf31a30a887a) Update for 1.5.1 - [`57bab43`](https://github.com/tigrish/devise-i18n/commit/57bab434865651ee36c5b603bc3782f90dbf1d68) Remove string with missing keys - [`1b1915f`](https://github.com/tigrish/devise-i18n/commit/1b1915f1e4a7a0625530fe93014021861baa3eca) Ensure the same string whether or not the user exists on login [#223](https://github.com/tigrish/devise-i18n/issues/223) - [`b771827`](https://github.com/tigrish/devise-i18n/commit/b771827bc60bef588754f00cc67c95c4ab742d19) Reapply not_found_in_database change - [`195a1b1`](https://github.com/tigrish/devise-i18n/commit/195a1b1c47ef9050993ea718c1e5691b2175f13d) Update from localeapp - [`717dbe8`](https://github.com/tigrish/devise-i18n/commit/717dbe8832f117dbb523400610b3ee1c90ef2086) Update not_found_in_database to match that provided by devise - [`37ece8a`](https://github.com/tigrish/devise-i18n/commit/37ece8a677ec8586f225251ab89089ab00f73675) Update from localeapp - [`17dfd61`](https://github.com/tigrish/devise-i18n/commit/17dfd616e957d7ef5ca676f002124f7cc45b50cd) Add info on scoped views [#220](https://github.com/tigrish/devise-i18n/issues/220) - [`704c1a0`](https://github.com/tigrish/devise-i18n/commit/704c1a0b908296254915b9b9cbc3d5860bcb7e9b) Update from localeapp - Additional commits viewable in [compare view](https://github.com/tigrish/devise-i18n/compare/v1.1.2...v1.5.1)

[![Dependabot compatibility score](https://api.dependabot.com/badges/ci_status?dependency-name=devise-i18n&package-manager=bundler&previous-version=1.1.2&new-version=1.5.1)](https://dependabot.com/compatibility-score.html?dependency-name=devise-i18n&package-manager=bundler&previous-version=1.1.2&new-version=1.5.1) Dependabot will resolve any conflicts with this PR as long as you don't alter it yourself. You can also trigger a rebase manually by commenting `@dependabot rebase`. If you'd like to skip this version, you can just close this PR. If you have any feedback just mention @dependabot in the comments below. --- **Note:** This repo was added to Dependabot recently, so you'll receive a maximum of 5 PRs for your first few update runs.
